amendatorysection.catchline: Foreign jurisdiction; civil action; subpoena for discovery in Nebraska; powers.
amendatorysection.para: (1) When authorized by rules promulgated by the Supreme Court, the clerk of the district court may issue a subpoena for discovery in Nebraska for a civil proceeding pending in a foreign jurisdiction. Such a subpoena may command a person to testify at a deposition or command a nonparty to provide discovery without a deposition.

(2) The Supreme Court may promulgate rules for subpoenas under this section. The rules may specify the amount of a fee, if any, that must be paid to the clerk of the district court for the issuance of such subpoenas. Any such rules shall not conflict with laws governing such matters.
